edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.core.util

Interface LoggingConfigurationTags

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigurationTags
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoggerProvider

    public interface LoggingConfigurationTags
extends ConfigurationTags
    Tags that are used in the logging XML element in a configuration file.

    Created by Jeff Gaynor
    on 4/12/12 at 9:46 AM

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String APPEND_ENABLED
      Append to existing log files on start or overwrite.
      static String DEBUG_ENABLED
      Enable debugging.
      static String DISABLE_LOG4J
      Disable log 4 java.
      static String LOG_FILE_COUNT
      Number of log files to have
      static String LOG_FILE_NAME
      File name to log to.
      static String LOG_FILE_SIZE
      Maximum size of a log file
      static String LOGGER_NAME
      Name of the log.
      static String LOGGING_COMPONENT
      Name of the component

      • LOGGING_COMPONENT

        static final String LOGGING_COMPONENT
        Name of the component
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_FILE_NAME

        static final String LOG_FILE_NAME
        File name to log to.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOGGER_NAME

        static final String LOGGER_NAME
        Name of the log. Each entry is prepended with this so that if there are multiple entries in the file they can be disambiguated.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_FILE_COUNT

        static final String LOG_FILE_COUNT
        Number of log files to have

        Maximum size of a log file
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG_ENABLED

        static final String DEBUG_ENABLED
        Enable debugging.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • APPEND_ENABLED

        static final String APPEND_ENABLED
        Append to existing log files on start or overwrite.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISABLE_LOG4J

        static final String DISABLE_LOG4J
        Disable log 4 java. At times badly behaving libraries have poorly configured log 4 java which can be very messy. This will kill off ALL log 4 java in the extreme case, so only use it if you need it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
